intro: Licania stricta, commonly known as the rigid licania, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically ovate with a smooth surface and are arranged alternately along the stems. Licania stricta is often found in wetlands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
